@description.name: @description
@description.body: Base class for all list item renderer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the row is selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the row is selectable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the row is removable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show an arrow in the row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets all defined child widgets. Override this method in your custom list item renderer and reset all widgets displaying data. Needed as the renderer is used for every row and otherwise data of a different row might be displayed, when not all data displaying widgets are used for the row. Gets called automatically by the {@link qx.ui.mobile.list.provider.Provider}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the row index of a certain DOM element in the list from the given event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the row index of a certain DOM element in the list.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} DOM element to retrieve the index from.
@param.description: DOM element to retrieve the index from.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
